thread.title: A ‘Shark Tank’ Panelist Talks About His Best and Worst Investments

author: Chris Kornelis
title: A ‘Shark Tank’ Panelist Talks About His Best and Worst Investments
text:
In 1989, Daymond John and some friends spent $40 and some elbow grease making hats in the home he shared with his mother. They sold out. Pretty soon, half of the house was a factory, and Mr. John and his friends had a feeding frenzy on their hands.
Building on their success, they branched out into other products. Within a decade, their FUBU apparel was being worn by the likes of LL Cool J, and clothes such as baggy jeans and football jerseys had made it an essential brand with young people and the hip-hop community.
